page.title: 15LIVING STANDARDS
page.content: In general, the standard of living of the people is quite high. Many families have a car. Of the house_ holds who do not, all are elderly couples or old ladies living alone. .the car gives us the freedom to seek our interests elsewhere, and for this reason village social life is much curtailed compared with, say, thirty years ago. Almost every household has a television set and a radio. There is a cinema in Hastings, and also occasional concerts and shows, but most people go to these only rarely. Many people take an annual vacation, possibly abroad. The main disadvant_ aged group are the very elderly living alon and probably without their own transport. The road is dangerous for walking so frail people can easily become housebound. For the rest of us walking in the countryside is a joy.
